Tooltips components

Popup that displays a description for an element when a user hovers over or focuses on that element. It should popup automatically when the user gives input focus to the widget or element with which it is associated.

Contents

  • Demo: tooltip with keyboard interaction
  • CSS powered tooltip
  • Enhancement with Javascript

The focusable element will display/provide a hint when the target element either has focus, either the mouse is over. However focus will remain on the target element.

Home link
Follow the link to return on the home page

CSS powered tooltip

By following the recommended markup, we add the aria-describedby attribute on the target and the tooltip role on the the hint. The idea then is to put the hint next to the target and use sibling css selector to reveal the tooltip.

Note with Javascript disabled, we can't hide the tooltip using the esc key

  • Markup
  • Style

index.html


<div id="tooltip-sample"><a href="/" aria-describedby="tooltip-hint">Home link</a>
  <div role="tooltip" id="tooltip-hint">Follow the link to return on the home page</div>
</div>

incex.css

#tooltip-sample {
    position: relative;
    display: inline-block;
    overflow: visible;
}

#tooltip-sample [role='tooltip'] {
    display: none;
    background: #3d3d3d;
    color: white;
    padding: 0.5rem;
    border-radius: 3px;
    position: absolute;
    bottom: 100%;
    margin-bottom: 1rem;
    left: 0;
    z-index: 9999;
    box-shadow: 1px 0.1rem 0.3rem 0 #818181;
    white-space: pre;
    opacity: 0;
    font-size: 0.8rem;
}

/*
react to both mouse and keyboard focus
*/
#tooltip-sample [aria-describedby]:focus + [role=tooltip],
#tooltip-sample [aria-describedby]:hover + [role=tooltip] {
    display: inline-block;
    animation-name: show-tooltip;
    animation-delay: 0.5s;
    animation-duration: 0.4s;
    animation-fill-mode: forwards;
}

@keyframes show-tooltip {
    from {
        opacity: 0;
    }
    to {
        opacity: 1;
    }
}

Enhancement with Javascript

By using lrtiste we simply add the recommended keyboard access (esc should dismiss the tooltip when focus is on the target element)

import {tooltip} from '../../../../components/tooltips';

const factory = tooltip();
factory({el: document.querySelector('#tooltip-sample > [role=tooltip]')});
